name: Tiropetes
author: HAPPYCOOKER03
summary: Straight from Athens! Feta and Monterey Jack cheeses are mixed into a sauce with parsley and used to fill phyllo triangles in this delicious Greek appetizer.
ingredients: salt and white pepper to taste
1 (16 ounce) package frozen phyllo dough, thawed
2 tablespoons chopped Italian flat leaf parsley
directions: Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat
Whisk in the flour until smooth
Gradually stir in the hot milk so that no lumps form
Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens enough to coat a metal spoon
Season with salt and white pepper, remove from the heat and set aside to cool
When the sauce is cooled, stir in the feta cheese, egg yolks, Monterey jack cheese, 3 tablespoons melted butter and parsley
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Cut the sheets of phyllo dough into strips about 3 inches wide
Use one stack at a time, covering the rest with a damp towel to keep them from drying out
Lay out one piece of phyllo at a time
Brush with butter, and place about 1 teaspoon of the cheese mixture on one end
Fold one corner up to match the other edge
Continue folding in triangle shape until you reach the end of the strip
Place on a baking sheet, and continue with the remaining strips of dough
Bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown
These can also be prepared ahead of time, and frozen after folding
